personas.name: Miley Cyrus
description: Female
18 year old student at the University of Toronto Scarborough
Specialist in Psychology
Familiar with technology such as Microsoft Office, Netflix and Facebook
Likes to take notes on her laptop
No programming experience or knowledge
Uses her phone in most cases, uses BlackBoard on mobile
Doesn't trust online homework systems because of bad experiences due to bugs and glitches
Doesn't like how educational tools look bland and have a rugged design/interface
Likes to solve problems on paper

personas.name: Aubrey Graham
description: Male
18 year old student at the University of Toronto Scarborough
Specialist in Sociology and minor in Computer Science
Proficient with technology, has programming experience in Java and C
Prefers to work on his laptop - everything from taking notes to doing assignments
Likes it when things are simple and easy to use
Doesn't care for extra features as long as he can get the job done
Prefers to have everything synchronized so he can access things from multiple devices (i.e., phone, laptop and smartwatch)

personas.name: Dr. Ryan Tishkovsky
description: Male
51 year old professor at University of Toronto Scarborough
Teaches introductory level statistics courses
Not a programmer, but uses technology frequently for basic tasks such as e-mail, writing assignments in Microsoft Word, and presentations in Microsoft PowerPoint
Dislikes writing assignment questions from scratch; prefers to have a template where he only needs to change specific numbers
Has a strong glasses prescription
Not an avid phone user, carries a flip phone with his family/emergency contacts in it
Very proficient with LaTeX and MATLAB as he used it throughout most of his career
Meets with TAs for each of his courses once a week to discuss teaching objectives for the following week

personas.name: Dr. Emilia Jenkins
description: Female
28 year old professor at the University of Toronto Scarborough
Graduated with a Bachelor's in Computer Science and Software Engineering
Masters and Ph.D in Computer Science from Carnegie Mellon University
4+ years of software engineering experience in the industry before teaching at the university
Avid programmer, prefers to code solutions for various tasks (i.e., assignments, tests and course materials)
Does not use phone other than for communication purposes (i.e., texting, calling). Uses a high-end laptop frequently
Meets with her TAs through a custom messaging solution she made herself
Capable of learning new technologies if she sees a use case in them
Does not like sitting down to mark assignments and exams, prefers to hand them off to TAs and get the overall scores back
